primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from a state of anxiety and violence to a state of vision and faithful action through the reception of God's alternative future.

tekstueel_bewijs: Our work is to fill out the vision
The task of those grounded in faith is to act
We do it because we are called

object.identificatie: The Vision (a new economy, international peace, justice)
tekstueel_bewijs: To imagine a new economy not based on greed
a coming future that is willed by God
It is the business of the prophet to offer a vision

ontvanger.identificatie: The World / The Vulnerable (widows, orphans, immigrants)
tekstueel_bewijs: a welcome practice of justice and mercy
half of my possessions... I will give to the poor
Such visioning action is in our baptismal DNA

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is primarily a psychological state (anxiety) or a social structure (empire) that the subject must overcome through 'courage and defiance'.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God's action in seeking the lost (Zacchaeus story).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Jesus
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon uses God's action (Program 2) as a fuel or 'invitation' for the human subject's primary task of imagining and acting (Program 1).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has got us all in his hands.
The Son of Man came to seek out and to save the lost.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We want to have more guns.
Our work is to fill out the vision.
We do it because we are called.

voorbeelden: It is an act of courage and defiance.
Write the vision, and make it plain.
Your body is loaded with the force of the spirit (attributed to Zacchaeus).

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a 'Recruitment' narrative. It focuses on awakening the will (Vouloir) and the imagination (Savoir) of the hearer to act against violence.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the human 'act of courage' to choose vision over violence.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Moderate; violence is seen as a result of anxiety rather than radical evil.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While using biblical language, the 'engine' of the sermon is the human capacity to imagine and act. God provides the 'vision' (the blueprint), but the Hearer is the Subject who must 'perform' it.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Our work is to fill out the vision.
Zacchaeus traces the poem of Habakkuk exactly... He responds in faith to perform the vision.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The Son of Man came to seek out and to save the lost.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Zacchaeus is presented as a model of how to move from violence to vision through a decision of the will.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: God shatters the violence of the empire by sovereignly claiming Zacchaeus, making his transformation a fruit of the Spirit rather than a 'performance' of a vision.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to 'imagine' and 'act' with enough courage to defeat global violence.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is rhetorically coherent but theologically strained between God's 'invitation' and man's 'task'.
spanning_punten: The vision 'will surely come' (God's act) vs 'Our work is to fill out the vision' (Man's act).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus offers Zacchaeus a vision of himself that contradicted his current practice.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is described as a 'force' already in the body (DNA) rather than a sovereign gift.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is equated with 'anxiety' and 'failing neighborly infrastructure'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a call to action where God is the Architect (Sender) and the Hearer is the Builder (Subject).

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is burdened with 'defeating' violence through imagination.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make the 'Vision' (Christ) the Subject who defeats violence.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'Our work is to imagine,' use 'The Gospel creates in us a new world.'

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Focus on Zacchaeus's inability to change until Jesus 'must' stay at his house.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize that we *cannot* imagine this new world unless the Spirit gives us the power.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Sin as a power that binds the will.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: If the opponent is just 'anxiety,' we don't need a Savior, just a therapist or a better dream.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: 1. God defeats violence in Christ. 2. Therefore, we are free to live peaceably.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically powerful but structurally moralistic. It risks exhausting the hearer by making the 'vision' a human task rather than a divine gift.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, this is an inspiring call to social justice; actantially, it is a law-driven mandate.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis identifies the 'vision' in Habakkuk as God's intervention, but the sermon turns it into human 'imagining'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that despite the mention of 'Jesus' and 'Baptism,' the 'Subject' of the active verbs remains the human 'we'.

volledige_subject_lijst: We want to have more guns
The church’s business is to watch
Our work is to fill out
appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'I Have a Dream' motif, which reinforces the 'Subject = Visionary' structure.
